did.abstract: The collection comprises a manuscript diary covering the years 1901-1902, written in 1912 from notes taken during that time period. Francis John Baker provides lengthy, detailed descriptions of his experiences in the Boer War and daily camp life. Military documents, family correspondence, and photographs are included.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Francis John Baker was born August 10, 1869, in Somerset, England. A corn merchant by trade, he joined the 48th North Somerset Imperial Yeomanry, arriving in South Africa in 1901. Lance Corporal Baker was honorably discharged in 1902.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises a manuscript diary covering the years 1901-1902, written in 1912 from notes taken during that time period. Baker provides lengthy, detailed descriptions of his experiences in the Boer War and daily camp life. Military documents, family correspondence, and photographs are included.

scopecontent.p: Baker's service in the war was during 1901-1902. Diary written from the leaves of a pocket pad in 1912.
